alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Morris; Somerset; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hunterdon, southwestern Morris, south central Sussex, east central Warren and northwestern Somerset Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lebanon, or 12 miles west of Somerville, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dover, Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Wharton, Rockaway, Mount Arlington, Mendham, High Bridge, Stanhope, Netcong, Clinton, Peapack And Gladstone, Glen Gardner, Chester, Victory Gardens, Lebanon, Califon, Far Hills, Andover and Greendell. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 15 and 28. Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 17 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern and northwestern New Jersey.
